pages.text: The mysterious rider moves slowly on a white horse, bearing a black banner emblazoned with the Mystic Rose, which signifies life.  Behind it lies the whole world of ascent in the spirit.$(br)  Between two pillars on the verge of the horizon there shines the sun of immortality.$(br)  The rider carries no visible weapon, yet all fall before them, sparing not even kings, bishops, children or maidens.$(br)  The veil or mask of life is perpetuated in change,

transformation and passage from lower to higher.$(br)  The natural transit of humans to the next stage of their being either is or may be one form of their progress; but the exotic and almost unknown entrance, while still in this life, into the state of mystical death is a change in the form of consciousness and the passage into a state to which ordinary death is neither the path nor gate.$(br)  The Thirteenth Card is placed between the visible and

the invisible worlds. It is the universal link in nature, the means by which all the influences react from one world to the other.$(br2)$(l)Divinatory meanings$()$(br)  Release from old patterns.$(br)  The end of something that has become burdensome or meaningless.$(br2)$(l)Reversed$()$(br)  Holding onto something even when you know it's finished.$(br)  Fear of change.
